term.name: pessimism
term.def: Specifically, the view of Artur Schopenhauer (1788-1860) that reality and human nature are essentially malevolent. More generally, the view (opposed to &optimism;) that knowledge and happiness are ultimately unattainable; degrees of pessimism range from mild (e.g., &stoicism;) to severe (e.g., &fatalism;).
